intro: Anthonotha obanensis, commonly known as the Oban bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Scottish Highlands. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue petals and is typically found growing in damp, shaded environments. The plant belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is known for its delicate, fragrant blooms. Anthonotha obanensis is a low-growing perennial that thrives in moist, acidic soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
